Gate of Gondor | location=Eastern point in the [[City Wall]] of [[Minas Tirith]] | type=Gate | description=Large rolling doors originally made of steel and iron, later ''[[mithril]]'' and steel | regions= | towns= | inhabitants= | created= | destroyed=[[15 March]] {{TA|3019}} | events=[[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]] | gallery=the Great Gate }} The '''Great Gate''' was the guarded doorway in the eastern point of the [[City Wall]], the outer wall on the first and lowest level of [[Minas Tirith]], the capital city of [[Gondor]].{{RK|MT}}{{rp|751–2}} ==Description== The Gate itself consisted of large rolling doors{{rp|751–2}} made of steel and iron with posts made of steel. It was protected by towers and bastions of indomitable stone.{{RK|Siege}}{{rp|828–9}} Behind the Gate was a wide court that ended at the base of the great "ship-keel" of stone that cut through most of the city.{{rp|751–2}} Before the Gate was a great paved space where all the roads that led through the [[Pelennor Fields]] to Minas Tirith converged.{{rp|770}} ==History== The city of Minas Tirith (then known as Minas Anor) was probably built after the founding of the realm of Gondor in {{SA|3320}}.{{App|SA}}, entry for the year 3320, p. 1084 It is probable that the Great Gate was built later during the history of the city, because Minas Anor was originally of less importance and only consisted of a small fort on the summit of Amon Anor with the main purpose of guarding [[Rath Dínen]], the Tombs of the Kings, while the rest of the rocky hill of Amon Anor was uninhabited.{{NM|P3xvii}}, Text 2, p. 365 On [[9 March]] {{TA|3019}},{{App|Great}}, pp. 1093-4 [[Gandalf]] and [[Peregrin Took|Pippin]] passed through the Great Gates on their way to meet [[Denethor|Denethor II]]. Seeing the wizard the men at the Gate knew that "the storm is indeed nigh!" Gandalf did not dissuade them of this conclusion, proclaiming, "It is upon you" and that he had "ridden on its wings".{{rp|751–2}} [[Faramir]] was retreating with his men to the city on [[10 March]] when the [[Nazgûl]] swooped upon them. Just before the Great Gate it appeared that they would reach Faramir when Gandalf rode in and dispelled them. The next day Denethor sent his son to man the [[Rammas Echor]]; when the forces of [[Sauron]] overwhelmed the defenders Faramir was again forced to lead his men back to the city. Again the Nazgûl dove upon the [[Gondorians]]. Not two furlongs from the Great Gate they attacked and this time managed to wound Faramir.{{rp|820–1}} In the great [[Siege of Gondor|siege of Minas Tirith]], on [[15 March]] {{TA|3019|n}}, after midnight the host of Sauron attacked the City Wall in many places to test the strength of the defences and to keep the defenders occupied in many places. They concentrated their attack on the Great Gate by moving great siege towers and [[Grond (battering ram)|Grond]], a hundred-foot long battering ram towards the gate under the command of the [[Witch-king]]. Shortly before dawn, the battering ram reached the gate and pounded the Great Gate four times while the Witch-king spoke words of power during the last three strokes of the ram. At the last stroke there was a flash of lightning and the gate broke and the fragments of the door fell to the ground. The Witch-king rode through the Great Gate where Gandalf awaited him and forbade him to enter,{{rp|828–9}} but then he turned back when the [[Rohirrim]] arrived to command his troops against the onrushing Rohirrim.{{RK|Battle}}, p. 839 After the rout of the host of Sauron from the Pelennor, a temporary barricade was erected in place of the Great Gate. Later, on [[1 May]] {{TA|3019|n}},{{App|Chief}}, entry for the year 3019, May 1, p. 1095 [[Aragorn]] received the [[Crown of Gondor]] in front of the ruined Gate and then [[Húrin the Tall|Húrin]], the [[Warden of the Keys]], opened the barricade for him to enter the City.{{RK|Steward}}, p. 966-8 Sometime after the [[War of the Ring]], [[Gimli]] became the Lord of [[Glittering Caves|Aglarond]]. He, and [[Dwarves]] from [[Lonely Mountain|Erebor]], built new Gates of ''[[mithril]]'' and steel for Minas Tirith as a replacement for the Great Gate that had been broken during the siege.{{App|Durin}}, entry about Gimli, p. 1080 ==Other names== The Great Gate of Minas Tirith was also referred to as the Great Gate of the City,{{rp|750}}{{RK|Muster}}, p. 791 the Gate of Minas Tirith,{{RK|Houses}}, p. 858 the Gate of the City,{{rp|820}}{{RK|Battle}}, p. 849 the City Gate,{{rp|827}} the City-gate{{rp|819}} or the Gate of Gondor.{{rp|829}} {{References}} [[Category:Doors and gates]] [[Category:Minas Tirith]] [[de:Großes Tor (Minas Tirith)]] [[fi:Suuri Portti (Minas Tirith)]]
